Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plate; white slip; interior: on rim (edge lost), tongue pattern with added red on alternate tongues; on floor, from outside: wide black band; frieze of dots between lines; black-figure frieze consisting of sphinx to left (only curlicue and wing remaining; with red on wing); part of incised rosette with red in centre as filling ornament; exterior glazed with added red bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 23, no. 78, pl. 22)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 319, no. 1415, pl. 181)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2147) (phase 2)
